info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 5:57AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Elbert, Laurens, southern Greenville, southeastern Spartanburg, southeastern Anderson, Abbeville, central Union and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 630 AM EST... At 557 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles north of Laurens to 12 miles northeast of Elberton. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greenwood, Laurens, Union, Abbeville, Clinton, Honea Path, Ware Shoals, Monarch Mill, Joanna and Buffalo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
